Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Camera class represent a camera that photo 3D geometries in the scene. Represented by point3D for the location of the camera and two vectors vUp and vTo for the directions of the camera. Photo the picture by constructing a Rays through pixels on the view plane.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Camera​(Point3D location, Vector vTo, Vector vUp)
    Construct a camera by two vectors and location.

    Construct a camera by two vectors and location.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D location, Vector vTo, Vector vUp)
      Construct a camera by two vectors and location. Calculate the third vector
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the camera
      vTo - vector from the camera to the geometry
      vUp - vector from the camera up - orthogonal to vTo

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D location, Vector vTo, Vector vUp, double focusDistance, double aperture, int dimensionRays, boolean actDepthOfField)
      Construct a camera by two vectors and location. Calculate the third vector
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the camera
      vTo - vector from the camera to the geometry
      vUp - vector from the camera up - orthogonal to vTo
      focusDistance - the distance between the camera and the focal plane
      aperture - Factor to the aperture size. Scaled in the pixel size

    • constructBeamThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructBeamThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      The constructRayThroughPixel function accepts parameters that represent View Plane and a specific pixel and returns a list of rays contain a ray from the camera to the same pixel. If depth of field feature is on return a list of rays contains in addition randomize rays from the aperture to the focus distance
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in x axis of view plane
      nY - number of pixels in y axis of view plane
      j - index of column on the view plane
      i - index of row on the view plane
      screenDistance - the distance from the camera to the view plane
      screenWidth - the total width of the view plane
      screenHeight - the total height of the view plane
      Returns:
      a list of rays to the geometry
